comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: On February 1, 1914, Captain John McClintock was appointed First Deputy Police Commissioner of New York City. He resigned ten months later; a New York Times story on December 8, 1914, hinted that the resignation had been inspired by a desire to accept a police post in the newly-created (and USA-administered) Panama Canal Zone. (McClintock had formerly held a customs post in Panama.): query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9B00E... Other Bain/LOC portraits of Capt. John McClintock: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4798749357/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4953635691/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4799377688/in/photostream/]
